meanings.definition: The arrangement of leaves on a stem.
meanings.sent1: The phyllotaxis of the plant allows for maximum sunlight exposure.
meanings.sent2: The phyllotaxis of the tree is such that each leaf gets its share of sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The gardener chuckled at the quirky phyllotaxis of the succulent.
meanings.sent4: The phyllotaxis of the leaves resembled a spiral staircase reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The phyllotaxis of the flowers created a mesmerizing pattern on the stem.

meanings.definition: The study of the arrangement of leaves on a stem.
meanings.sent1: Botanists use phyllotaxis to understand how plants optimize their growth.
meanings.sent2: In college, she specialized in phyllotaxis and plant morphology.
meanings.sent3: The phyllotaxis research project kept the scientists busy for months.
meanings.sent4: The intricate phyllotaxis analysis revealed fascinating patterns in nature.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on phyllotaxis provided valuable insights into plant development.
